content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans. This is a read-only planning session - I can read files, search for patterns, and analyze the architecture, but I cannot create or modify any files.

Let me start by getting an overview of the project structure.

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Bash">
<parameter name="command">find /Users/imorgado/SPLICE_PLEASE -type f -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.tsx" -o -name "*.js" -o -name "*.json" -o -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<thinking>
The user wants me to warm up by exploring the codebase. Let me get an overview of the project structure first.
</thinking>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Glob">
<parameter name="pattern">**/*</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<thinking>
Let me explore the project structure to understand what we're working with.
</thinking>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/imorgado/SPLICE_PLEASE/README.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<thinking>
Let me read the README to understand the project.
</thinking>

I now have an overview of the project. This is **Splice v3**, an Adobe Premiere Pro UXP Plugin for AI-powered video editing. Here's what I found:

**Project Overview:**
- A React-based UXP plugin for Adobe Premiere Pro
- Uses TypeScript with React 18
- Integrates with AI services (MCP client) for intelligent editing
- Follows Adobe Spectrum design system

**Key Directories:**
- `/src/panels/` - React components for UI panels
- `/src/adobeApi/` - Adobe Premiere Pro API wrappers
- `/src/utils/` - Utility functions and configurations
- `/src/types/` - TypeScript type definitions
- `/public/` - Static assets and plugin manifest

**Main Features:**
- Chat interface for AI-powered editing
- Project analysis tools
- Timeline visualization
- Tool/resource execution system

I'm ready to explore any specific requirements or design tasks you'd like me to analyze. What would you like me to investigate?
